Container.Name: tuya2mqtt
Container.Overview: This is a template for https://github.com/tonyfav/tuya2mqtt 's container, which makes devices with serial protocols that are not supported in Tasmota available to Home Assistant.

Config.Name: MQTT Host
Config.Description: Change to whatever IP your MQTT broker is available at. Use LAN IP values, not Docker IP values.

Config.Name: MQTT Port
Config.Description: Should be default 1883. Do not change unless your broker uses a different port.

Config.Name: MQTT Password
Config.Description: Password registered for that user in broker

Config.Name: MQTT Client
Config.Description: The topic you want the device to appear as in Home Assistant

Config.Name: Device topic
Config.Description: Replace this with the topic that your device appears as in your broker. This can be easily found in Tasmota at the main menu under 'Information' > 'MQTT Full Topic'.

Config.Name: Device Type
Config.Description: Use https://github.com/tony-fav/tuya2mqtt/tree/master/devices to determine what device you have, then translate that into all lowercase while replacing spaces with underscores (e.g. Asakuki Diffuser is asakuki_diffuser).

Config.Name: HA Client
Config.Description: The topic you want the device to appear as in Home Assistant. If you have a different device, PLEASE PUT A FORWARD SLASH AT THE END. (e.g. the diffuser used earlier is tuya2mqtt/asakuki_diffuser/)
